events.originalText: After accidentally straying into Israeli-occupied airspace, Libyan Arab Airlines FlightÂ 114 was shot down by two fighter aircraft, killing 108 of the 113 people on board.
events.subtitle: Libyan Arab Airlines Flight 114
events.headline: Libyan Arab Airlines Flight 114 shot down in Israeli-occupied airspace, 108 killed

events.originalText: Black nationalist Malcolm X was assassinated while giving a speech in New York City's Audubon Ballroom.
events.subtitle: Black nationalism
events.headline: Malcolm X assassinated during speech in NYC's Audubon Ballroom

events.originalText: British artist Gerald Holtom unveiled a logo for the Campaign for Nuclear Disarmament that later became internationally recognised as the peace sign.
events.subtitle: Gerald Holtom
events.headline: Campaign for Nuclear Disarmament logo unveiled by British artist Gerald Holtom

events.originalText: A number of student protesters demanding the establishment of Bengali as an official language were killed by police in Dhaka, East Pakistan.
events.subtitle: Bengali language movement
events.headline: Student protesters demanding Bengali as official language killed by police in Dhaka

events.originalText: In the first battle of the Warlord Rebellion in northeastern Shandong against the Nationalist government of China, a 24,000-strong rebel force led by Zhang Zongchang was defeated at Zhifu by 7,000 NRA troops.
events.subtitle: Warlord Rebellion in northeastern Shandong
events.headline: Rebel force led by Zhang Zongchang defeated in Warlord Rebellion battle

events.originalText: Bavarian socialist Kurt Eisner, who had organized the German Revolution that overthrew the Wittelsbach monarchy and established Bavaria as a republic, was assassinated.
events.subtitle: Bavaria
events.headline: Bavarian socialist Kurt Eisner assassinated after German Revolution

events.originalText: The first telephone directory, consisting of a single page, was issued to fifty subscribers in New Haven, Connecticut.
events.subtitle: Telephone directory
events.headline: First telephone directory issued in New Haven, Connecticut

events.originalText: Lucy Hobbs Taylor (pictured) became the first woman to receive a doctorate from a dental college.
events.subtitle: Lucy Hobbs Taylor
events.headline: Lucy Hobbs Taylor becomes first woman to receive dental college doctorate

events.originalText: American Civil War: The Confederate Army began an attempt to gain control of the Southwest with a major victory in the Battle of Valverde.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: Confederate Army gains major victory in Battle of Valverde during American Civil War

events.originalText: The inaugural issue of the Cherokee Phoenix, the first newspaper in a Native American language, was published.
events.subtitle: Cherokee Phoenix
events.headline: Cherokee Phoenix, first newspaper in Native American language, published

events.originalText: Jacobite rising of 1745: The siege of Inverness ended with British forces surrendering to the Jacobite army.
events.subtitle: Jacobite rising of 1745
events.headline: Siege of Inverness ends with British forces surrendering to Jacobite army

events.originalText: King James I of Scotland was murdered at Perth in a failed coup by his uncle and former ally Walter Stewart, Earl of Atholl.
events.subtitle: James I of Scotland
events.headline: King James I of Scotland murdered in failed coup at Perth by Walter Stewart, Earl of Atholl
